Macron faces risk of destabilized presidency as PM Bayrou expected to fall
description: The French president has ruled out resigning or dissolving the Assemblée Nationale, the latter of which some in his camp see as inevitable. Mounting opposition pressure, the specter of a major social movement and the need to pass the budget before December 31 are forcing him to act quickly.

Chicago mayor defies Trump's immigration crackdown plan for the city: 'He is reckless and out of control'
description: Mayor Brandon Johnson, on Saturday, directed all city departments to guard the constitutional rights of Chicago residents from Trump's crackdown. Chicago is home to a large immigrant population, and both the city and the state of Illinois have some of the country's strongest rules against cooperating with federal immigration enforcement.

headline: French youth fund summer holidays in Marseille through 'narcotourism'
description: Young people visiting the southern French city for holidays and finding themselves short on cash or accommodation sometimes end up offering their services as lookouts or dealers at drug-selling spots.

headline: In Hawaii, the repentant volcano: 'I see it as a metaphor for the misuse of our planet's resources'
description: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (3/6). In Hawaii, there is a local belief that the goddess Pele brings misfortune to careless visitors who dare to take a piece of volcanic earth with them. To ward off this 'curse,' many return their stolen souvenirs along with a note of apology. Photographer Ryan Thompson has compiled these testimonies of repentance.

headline: Mohammed Hilles' first days in France after arriving from Gaza: 'I went to a baroque concert at the Philharmonie. It filled me with joy, sadness and nostalgia'
description: Hilles, 25, left Gaza to study music at Paris-Saclay University. After the initial relief of his arrival, he has grown increasingly worried about his family in the Palestinian enclave.

Mohammed VI, Islam and the Islamists
description: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (6/6). His status as 'commander of the faithful' has given the Moroccan king a unique aura and has enabled him to push back against the ambitions of Islamists, whose political project and way of life he rejects.

headline: Is France's debt situation as worrying as PM François Bayrou claims?
description: The French prime minister justifies the €44 billion in budgetary efforts he is demanding for 2026 by citing the worrying state of public finances. But is the situation really that dire?

headline: Air quality in Paris: Monitoring agency reports significant improvement over 10 years
description: According to Airparif, the independent body monitoring air quality in the Paris region, policies have had a 'significant and measurable impact.'
